intro: Hibbertia davisii, commonly known as the Banksia-leaved hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that resemble those of the Banksia genus. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has woody stems with alternate, ovate to lance-shaped leaves. Hibbertia davisii is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to coastal conditions with high salt exposure. It plays an important ecological role in supporting local pollinators and bird species.
